author: Liqwid Labs
title: Liqwid Protocol Security Audit
description: DeFi protocols built in Plutus are new, untested design patterns for constructing UTXO smart contracts that will soon hold billions in TVL.

assessments.note: Good on the Liqwid team to recognize the complexity in their lending dApp means a security audit of contracts before deploying to mainnet is a must.
Liqwid/MLabs team are working with an experienced group of Haskell dev shops to review their codebase/smart contracts before the v1 go-live.

Liqwid/MLabs Haskell engineers are using the deliverables in the proposal (code review and audit) to refactor their smart contracts/design pattern based on advisory/code review sessions with Well-Typed.

The problem and description are reasonable and are in line with the challenge. The proposal aims to audit the release version of Liqwid and is a crucial step in ensuring the reliability and security of DeFi projects.

The metrics and goals described indicate the alignment and impact on the challenge.
The Liqwid team is building a complex DeFi dApp that requires a security audit before going live, the dev team has also begun engaging with Well-Typed engineers for continuous code review sessions.

Every DeFi dApp requires a  protocol security audit before launching, to secure the system's attack vectors, build trust with end users, and validate the design patterns used in the dApp. This protocol effectively addresses the challenge.
Deciding to work with the top Haskell development firms to audit the 1st DeFi lending protocol to launch on Cardano is effectively addressing the challenge.

As one of the early DeFi protocols to launch on Cardano the amount of fidelity the community is placing in this protocol is high and a security audit is the only way to cement the security of a system for end users/developers who will build atop Liqwid.
Liqwid/MLabs Team has solid foresight to complete this critical step in their development process of completing a security audit by Tweag/Well-Typed before deploying contracts to Plutus MN.

DeFi protocols with smart contract that custody user funds via interest rates curves must be audited before real funds are deposited. the Well-Typed/Tweag teams Liqwid has chosen to complete this work are class Haskell dev firms.
The security audit is the final stage every Cardano DeFi protocol must complete before launching and the Liqwid team is engaging with two of the top Haskell development firms to complete this work.
The Liqwid protocol already exists, but the whole DeFi ecosystem is at risk if a hack is exploited.
The team has already begun work on the 1st of the 2 deliverables with the Well-Typed team and are working closely with the Plutus delivery team.

The proposal includes a project plan, goals/deliverable expectations, total developer hours and budget to complete the main deliverables in the coming months. The team is also working closely with the IOHK Plutus team.
Liqwid Labs/MLabs team are working with a highly experienced set of Haskell development firms to fulfill the outlined deliverables.

There are details on the experience of the team and external collaborators, indicating their aptitude and the extreme quality of those involved in executing the proposal. The teams involved in the audit are specialists in Haskell and Plutus, with one of the consultants being Duncan Coutts, one of the main technical references at IOG.

There is a clear and objective plan for the process of auditing, the parties involved and the time needed to conduct the audit.

The budget described is reasonable and has details on its allocation.
The dev team behind this proposal has a track record of building and the MLabs team previous experience in fintech platforms lends a lot of credibility to this proposal.
The developers have selected highly experienced engineers to exhaustively audit/review the code in the Liqwid smart contracts. The plan presented is sufficient.

Tweag/Well-Typed developers working on this proposals deliverables: 1. the code review and 2. the security audit are well known industry veterans in the Haskell space. This combined with the experience of the MLabs team means success in implementation is high for this proposal.
The plan presented is clear and focused plus the team has already begun delivering on their 1st deliverable.
The presented plan is complete and outlines the Liqwid/MLabs plan to complete code review sessions followed by a full security audit of the Liqwid protocol smart contracts.
The team experience is made clear from their open source Haskell project work, the presented plan is complete and it's likely the proposal will be successfully implemented.
The proposal, plan presented and team behind this are well defined and experienced which makes this proposal highly likely to be implemented successfully.

The approach is a traditional security audit.
It's unclear to me how continuous code review improves security and why code review was not in place from day one.
The proposal provides sufficient info and outlines the Liqwid team's plan for continuous code review and a security audit leading up to mainnet launch.

This proposal provides sufficient info and explains why the hard requirement for protocol security audit pre-launch exists. The software dev firms selected to work with the Liqwid/MLabs team have expert Haskellers who can fully test the protocol architecture/implementation.

Simple to audit whether hours are done. Whether the security audit found all bugs will only be known in the future.I'd like to see the proposers provide some measurable KPI's as to how this project meets the challenge goal of scaling up DeFi in Cardano in general/
The information presented in this proposal is sufficient to track the Liqwid code review/audit progress.

There is clarity in the description of the problem and how the solution presented will address the challenge.

The development of the audit is already underway and the deadline for the audit of the final version is scheduled for July. There is a clear, objective timeline.

There are objective metrics and deliverables.

There are details about the team and budget allocation.
Tweag/Well-Typed Haskell dev firms working with the Liqwid/MLabs team on this proposal have the senior talent on deck required to deliver on the proposal's goals.

Liqwid protocol is a set of interconnected Plutus smart contracts that must be audited and exhaustively tested before reaching mainnet. This proposal provides sufficient information on the team's plans to complete this.
The team behind the proposal has a complete project plan to fully test/audit their Plutus smart contracts before mainnet. the info provided is also sufficient to audit the project's progress.
Liqwid/MLabs team proposal has sufficient detail in the plan presented and are working alongside top Haskell firms to implement.
Information provided in this proposal is sufficient and the Liqwid/MLabs team has already begun working on one of the deliverables they highlight in their presented plan. This proposal is auditable.
The presented plan to test/audit the first interest rate protocol on Cardano is in line with the DeFi focused challenge and the info provided is sufficient to audit the project progress.

The Liqwid/Mlabs team is on the way to delivering the first lending solution on Plutus mainnet and security audit is a crucial step in that path. The plan presented is well defined, the proposer experience is made clear and the info included is sufficient to audit the proposal's progress.
There are 2 cleat deliverables which are key results by themselves.

solution: We want to integrate continuous code review of Liqwid smart contracts & conduct a security audit of the protocol leading up to v1.0 launch.
experience: Liqwid Labs is building an open source lending protocol in Plutus with a team of 6 senior Haskell devs and development partner MLabs.
